name: Surma
text: You are now able to write WebAssembly without learning a new language, and harness all these benefits WebAssembly might offer you. I think that is kind of powerful. AssemblyScript is absolutely usable, and very enjoyable!
title: WebAssembly for Web Developers (Google I/O â€™19)

name: Alon Zakai
text: AssemblyScript is designed with WebAssembly and code size in mind. It's not an existing language that we are using for a new purpose but it's a language designed for WebAssembly. It has great wasm-opt integration, in fact it's built with it, and it's very easy to get good code size.
title: Shipping Tiny WebAssembly Builds (WebAssembly Summit)

name: Peter Salomonsen
text: I chose AssemblyScript because it has high-level readability and low-level control. It's like a high-level language but you get that low-level feeling and you can even directly write WebAssembly intrinsics if you want to.
title: WebAssembly Music (WebAssembly Summit)
